Title: Workflow Tasks-  Launch & Accept
Description:
This smoke test checks basic workflow functionality including:
- Core task functions such as accepting, saving, and completing tasks, viewing the workflow status 
- Basic administrative functions for workflow processes such as suspending and canceling workflows
Steps:
Step 1: Double click on task in Expert Assistant | Expected: Ensure the task gets opened within 5 seconds. If there are multiple task performers, the Task should open in an unaccepted state. || Step 2: If the task is in an unaccepted state, click the accept button | Expected: Ensure the task becomes editable, and the correct user name is stated as the performer. || Step 3: Select "Unaccept"  in ribbon bar | Expected: Ensure the task goes into an uneditable state. || Step 4: Accept the task || Step 5: Attempt to complete the task when there are validation errors (if there are no validation errors, create one by either removing data from a required field, or selecting "decline" and not filling in a comment) | Expected: The task is unable to be completed when there are validation errors. || Step 6: Complete some data within the task form, and choose to save and close the task. Re-open task. | Expected: Ensure that your data did save. || Step 7: From the task window, launch the Status window | Expected: Ensure the diagram opens correctly and indicates the correct status of the workflow. More details expands the milestones and includes task status || Step 8: Enter a note in the task embedded notes container of a task (A little button in the bottom right). Set this as high priority and attach a file with size < 20 Mb. Select "Save task" and choose to post the note | Expected: Open the notes manager from the notes option in the toolbar. You should see the previously created note. || Step 9: Append another note to the notes conversation | Expected: Ensure this is saved. Close notes manager. || Step 10: Fill in all mandatory fields and complete the task | Expected: Check that the task has been successfully completed. || Step 11: Launch Expert Assistant from Start menu (CO/MSI install), and navigate to Task Inbox | Expected: Ensure WF tasks appear in your "My Task" List of your inbox. Title states the display name, and the started date in PC time. || Step 12: Reassign one task to another user with  different priority | Expected: Task is reassigned with correct priority || Step 13: Refresh the task list and check the task | Expected: The task should be disappeared in the task list || Step 14: Share a task to another user , with different priority | Expected: Task is shared with correct priority || Step 15: Navigate to the processes list | Expected: Ensure there is a list of Processes with the appropriate start date. || Step 16: For a running process that has open tasks, suspend the process by right-click "suspend". | Expected: Ensure that the icon changes to suspended and any active tasks are no longer visible in any task lists || Step 17: Resume the suspended process | Expected: Ensure the icon changes back to running. and the task is returned to user's task list. || Step 18: Select a process and cancel it. | Expected: Ensure this is performed correctly, and the icon changes to canceled. Open the status window and ensure the state is cancelled (may change to "complete" but must state the workflow was actually cancelled). Navigate to task list, and ensure that the task is removed. || Step 19: Pre condition - Workflow running on environment .                                                                 Run the following script: select*
from WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY s
inner join WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK e on s.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID=e.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID and e.CUSTOMTRACKRECORDNAME='WorkflowReferencesTrackingRecord'
where
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE1 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE2 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE3 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE4 is null | Expected: No results should be found.  Public data values in  WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY should not be null.

Exceptions:
In the Actions menu in EA, there are two other factors that may influence the visibility of actions when proxying other users
1. User-based config will be displayed for the actual user, not the user being proxied
2. If an action is secured, this may restrict the action being available to a proxy (e.g. the person being proxied may have security. but the proxy does not. In this case, the proxy will NOT see the other user's secured actions).

Title: Set filters on data provider
Description:
**Note: updated the test to be using just "OPEN" for the matter field instead of "!OPEN" as the use of the ! to filter OUT statuses (or anything) hadn't been implemented, and most likely will not be implemented** In step 3 of the SF Wizard, there are two new properties on Search Boxes that accompany a data provider. These will be used at runtime to provide a subset of the results normally returned by the data provider selected.
 
- Filter Property:            The attribute type that you may filter this data provider on
- Filter Value:                The values that will apply to the filter property selected
 
These properties will only be enabled for specific data providers for which filter properties have been allowed for. For some data providers, the available filter properties are generated, while others are specifically coded for. (What are the rules behind which data providers have filters and which ones do not?)
E.g.
- Client (specific)
- Matter (specific)
- Employee (specific)
- Office (generated)
 
 
Most filter properties only allow a single item which is either a literal value or a variable. 
> If a VARIABLE value is selected, the filter value applied to the data provider CAN be dynamically updated at runtime. Having selected a filter property that only allows single values, set the Filter Value using by which the data provider will be filtered. This property will accept values, but not expressions.
> If a literal value is selected, the filter value applied to the data provider cannot be dynamically updated at runtime. The same filter value will always apply. Having selected a filter property that only allows single values, set the Filter Value using by which the data provider will be filtered. This property will accept values, but not expressions.
 
Further examples of data providers that allow multiple filter values
Data Provider                            Filter Property 
Employee                                     EmployeeIds (expects comma-delimited list of empl_unos from hbm_persnl) 
Matter                                          Statuses (expects comma-delimited list of status_codes from hbl_status_matt)
Client                                           EntityTypes (expects comma-delimited list of db_value from cxl_code_lookup where lookup_group='EntityType')
Client                                           Statuses (expects comma-delimited list of status_codes from hbl_status_clnt)

Title: Set Recognise Decimal parameter for duration picker
Description:
A new parameter 'RecogniseDecimals' has been added to specify what format to treat data ENTERED by a user in the duration picker. It is only applicable if the display mode for the duration picker is HH:MM. So assuming display mode is HH:MM, and the the parameter is TRUE, the data entered is treated as decimal, however if the parameter is false, the data entered is treated as HH:MM. If the display mode is decimal, the ''RecogniseDecimals' data entered is ALWAYS treated as decimal.
 
Currently, the 'RecogniseDecimals' parameter can only be maintained in Configuration Manager (there is no other UI to set this):
>Technical > Presentation > Windows > Controls > DurationPicker > RecogniseDecimals (default=true)
 
* Display mode: HH:MM, RecogniseDecimals=True
Data entered by the user is treated as being entered in decimal mode. 
In this case, if a user enters 
     1.5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1.5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1:5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1 5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
 
 
* Display mode: HH:MM, RecogniseDecimals=False
Data entered by the user is treated as being entered in HH:MM mode. 
In this case, if a user enters 
     1.5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1.5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1:5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1 5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
 
 
NOTE: This parameter only applies to the WPF version of the duration picker, so will not affect the duration picker on the web etc.

Template policies apply as they are consumed in specific areas. It does not make sense to set members on such policies via Security Manager. Users/user groups should only be assigned to the policies when they relate to a specific area/instance.
 
For example, several of the policies created for workflow security are template policies. Users will be assigned to these policies when they are consumed in a specific workflow. They should not apply to all workflows.

Title: Copy and link a Module Policy
Description:
Rules for linking a module policy:
1. Linking of policy only works for when a Template policy is copied as a Firm policy. Copying and linking of a Firm policy will not have any relationship between the copy and the copied versions. 
2. By Retaining the link to the original template policy:
a. only additions or deletions on the resource on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around
b. only additions or deletions on the members on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Create package from different applications
Description:
A package definition is the package metadata which consists of a set of attributes describing what a customization package is about. A package definition must be created before associating customized data to the package and exporting the package. A package definition is stored in the following tables:
GGRelease(.Net 3.5): FCM_CustomizationPackage table in the framework database
GGSP1RTM (.Net4.0) onwards: Configuration.FWM_Package table in the Expert/Framework database:
80 onwards: FWM_PACKAGE
 
Details:
The package metadata is stored in FWM_Package, and contained in the Manifest.XML on export:
Id                                    Customization package GUID id
Name                              Customization package name
Description                     Full description of the customization package                
Version                          Version string of a customization package (The version format is enforced) - generated during package export
Create Date                    DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package definition was created - stamped when package definition is created inUTC time
Import Date                     DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package was imported into the system - stamped during package import - UTC time
OwnerId                         This is the site owner who owns the package - site owner info is entered via the site owner plugin in InstallationManager)
Steps: Step 1: Create a new package in the following applications:a) Configuration Managerb) SmartForm Wizard for BASIC SmartFormsc) When creating ad hoc list for a SmartFormd) Smartform wizard for Advanced SmartForme) When creating new workflowf) Security policy via Security Managerg) Domain customization via Domain Wizard | Expected: The package metadata is stored in FWM_Package, and contained in the Manifest.XML on export: Id Customization package GUID Name Customization package name Description Full description of the customization package Version Version string of a customization package (The version format is enforced) - generated during package export Create Date DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package definition was created - stamped when package definition is created in UTC time Import Date DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package was imported into the system - stamped during package import - UTC time OwnerId This is the site owner who owns the package - site owner info is entered via the site owner plugin in InstallationManager)

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging use case - Remove multiple content types in package
Description:
A package uninstall process attempts to remove a customization package from a system. This involves calling packaging plugins to handle the removal of customized data associated with the package for all package content types and unregistering the package from the system by removing the package definition record. This process could leave existing data in an inconsistent state. This would need to be fixed manually.
 
Package that is removed should include:
- Configuration
- SmartForms
- AdhocLists
- Security Policies
- Domain Customizations
 
Items that will not be removed:
- Workflows
- Additional files
- Categories
- Advanced SF assemblies
 
NOTE:
- Cannot remove published workflows - must be removed manually from IIS
- The 'Remove'  button for packages in Deployment Manager does not remove any workflow definitions
- NB: Running instances in a workflow authoring environment can be removed via the Run Wokrflow dialog window when you press the Start without Debugging button in Design Studio

Title: Install License for single resource
Description:
A license may be created for a set number of users, which is shipped to clients as a package that they install via our packaging mechanism.
This test will verify a license that is managed by the number of users, and does NOT have a fixed duration or time component.
 
When a license package is imported, 
1. An license record is created in Configuration Manager
  (a) Configuration path for item: Technical.Licensing.License.{LicenseName} 
       (The LicenseName is derived from the name of the module in which the licensed resources reside)
  (b) Contains the following details: Licensee name, Secured Resource, User Limit, User Type (User/Timekeeper) , Expiry Date
  (c) Has scope of System, and has Aderant package assigned to it (which one?)
  (d) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services
 
2. Which then kicks off a status update, resulting in a status record in Configuration Manager
   (a) Configuration path for item: Technical.Licensing.Status.{ResourceName} 
   (b) Contains the following details: 
               ResourceName, IsLicensedStatus, BreachTimeStamp
               Licensee name 
               List of licenses that the resource is contained, current user count, and violation message if currently in breach
               Signature information (to ensure the record cannot be manually overwritten)
 
NOTE:
A user is classified as a timekeeper if:  TIME_OK ON TBM_PERSNL = 'Y'

Title: Create & import new license for single resource
Description:
NOTE: SP2 and later, only need licenses for Collections, Expenses and OTG. Instead of creating licenses for Prebill, use ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections OR Expenses.ExpensesApplication
 
LicenseGenerator.exe is a console application that generates a license package that can be imported into a target deployment.
 
NOTE:​ The machine on which LicenseGenerator.exe is run must have the Aderant code signing certificate installed in the Trusted Publishers store.​
(The certificate can be found in Source Control: {BranchName}\Modules\Build. Infrastructure\Src\Build\aderant.pfx, and installed by double-clicking on it. When going through the wizard, ensure you select to store it in the Trusted Publishers location).
 
PARAMETERS:
/licensee:<string> License owner, must match target system owner i.e. /l:[Expert System Owner]. (short form /l) 
/module:<string> License module, the name of the module being licensed i.e. /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo. (short form /m) 
/resource:<string> Security resource path i.e. /r:ExpertTime.ExpertTimeApplication, ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication (short form /r) 
/expiry:<string> License expiry, the expiry date of the license, unlimited if not specified i.e. /e:31-03-2016 or /e:unlimited or /e:"1 May 2016". (short form /e) 
/userlimit:<string> License user limit, the number of users allow under this license, unlimited if not specified. (short form /ul) 
/usertype:<string> License user type, the type of user this license covers. "user" or "timekeeper", "user" if not specified. (short form /ut) 
/outputfolder:<string> The destination folder for the output, default is the execution folder. (short form /of)
 
EXAMPLES:
​​​Limited Expiry and limited Timekeepers license
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo /r:ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication /e:"30 Jun 2014" /ul:150 /ut:timekeeper /of:c:\temp
Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Timekeepers using defaults
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo /r:ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication /ut:timekeeper /of:c:\temp
Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Users with explicit parameters
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertMatterPlanning /r:MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplication /e:unlimited /ul:unlimited /ut:user /of:c:\temp
​Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Users with explicit parameters
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertMatterPlanning /r:MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplication /e:"30 Jun 2014" /ul:150/ut:user /of:c:\temp
Output:
 
Using the last example the output would be a package named "ExpertMatterPlanning_license.zip" and a license xml named "ExpertMatterPlanning_license.xml" in folder C:\temp.
 
The package contains a configuration import of the content of the license xml to the path "Technical.Licensing.License"

Title: Update License Status Records
Description:
First
- create/updated on license  - one per resource
- on access (if earlier than today, then update record considered out of date --> Update the existing status records IF not updated today OR the any of the LICENSE records have been updated since the status record 
UNLESS update today was from import license package
--> updates all resources in license
 
 
Cf. Security Manager - updates ALL status records for ALL licenses regardless of then last status update was
 
 
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for standard Users):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
Select the ''PaperlessPrebill_ExpertPaperlessPrebillApplication'' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
If this count is > 10, then in breach
If this count is <= 10, then not in breach
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for Timekeepers):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
To identify users that are considered timekeepers, look at the timekeeper on time entries created in the last 3 months (TAT_TIME)
From this list, 
Select the '''' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
Of this list, count the number that are timekeepers (also appear in the list above) 
If this count is > x then in breach
If this count is <= x then not in breach

Title: Update Status Record for number of users

* License x users, unlimited time --> Number of users exceeded
* License x timekeepers, unlimited time --> Number of timekeepers exceeded
* License unlimited users, with expiry date --> Past expiry date
* License x users, with expiry date --> Number of users exceeded, expiry date not breached 
* License x timekeepers, with expiry date --> Past expiry date, number of timekeepers not exceeded
* License x timekeepers, with expiry date --> Past expiry date, number of timekeepers exceeded

- create/updated on license  - one per resource
- on access (if earlier than today, then update record considered out of date --> Update the existing status records IF not updated today OR the any of the LICENSE records have been updated since the status record
